alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 9:58AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: A weak cold front moved through southeast Wyoming last night which allowed for Canadian high pressure to build into the area. Along with this Canadian high pressure, areas of smoke from Canadian Wildfires has begun to seep into southeast Wyoming. This smoke has been fairly dense especially along and east of the I-25 corridor where the visibility had dropped below one mile at times this morning around Torrington. The smoke will continue to spread south and west through the remainder of the day and tonight. If you are outdoors please be extra cautious and avoid prolonged exposure to smoke.
